intro: Ricinocarpus tomentosus, commonly known as the velvet fern, is a unique plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a velvety appearance. The plant is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by small, round fruits that contain seeds. Due to its distinctive appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
